ol.li:
Everyone involved in working at height and rescue procedures should be trainedÂ on fall protection, rescue equipment and procedures:
How to inspect, anchor, assemble and use fall protection and rescue equipment safely.
How to recognise fall hazards.
How to implement fall hazard control methods.
How to conduct fall protection and rescue procedures.
How to inspect equipment and systems before use.

The authorized Rescuer must be trained by a competent rescuer trainer and then retrained should the nature of his work change, or if there are other changes in circumstances. The Rescuer must also be evaluated by a competent trainer at least once annually.
All training needs to be well documented; documents need to be archived for at least 3 years, depending on local regulations.
